The Swami's authorised agent met the election authorities and submitted a letter announcing the Swami's withdrawal from contest. The mutt head has not revealed the reason why he was stepping aside from the contest, but said he was doing so based on his Guru's advise.

He said he has not decided who to support, as of now.

Chief Minister Siddaramaiah in a post on X said he appealed to the Swami to withdraw from the race and instead support the Congress as the mutt he heads was known for its secular values and the Congress needed his support.

That leaves BJP's and Congress party's Vinod Asuti in the fray as major players.

The Swami, who heads the Fakireshwara Mutt at Shirahatti, had urged the BJP to replace Joshi accusing him of trying to suppress Lingayats in the region, a charge the minister rebuffed.

Joshi, a Brahmin, is seeking election for a fifth successive term from Dharwad, with Lingayats throwing their weight behind him.

Joshi rode to political fame and helped the BJP cement its position in the region by leading a movement to hoist tricolour at the Idgah Maidan in Hubballi in the early 1990s. He has been winning with Lingayats throwing their weight behind him."

b"Former CMs, a deputy CM, and a Union minister are contesting in six Lok Sabha seats along the Pune-Bengaluru highway in Karnataka. The candidates face various challenges, including resistance from local leaders and the need to leverage the Modi factor for support.Two former chief ministers, a former deputy CM and a Union minister are among the BJP candidates seeking election from six Lok Sabha constituencies spread along the 700-km Pune-Bengaluru national highway.

Each of these seats comes with its own set of challenges for BJP that had turned in a stupendous performance in 2019, winning 25 out of the 28 seats in Karnataka.

Tumakuru

Former minister V Somanna is facing some heat on the seat won by BJP five times since 1991. The party leadership fielded him responding to his demand, though sections of BJP leaders, especially local strongman JC Madhuswamy, see him as an outsider. Somanna, 73, earlier an MLA from Bengaluru, had lost from two seats in the assembly polls including against Siddaramaiah, the current CM. Some locals say only the Modi factor could save Somanna.

Chitradurga (SC)

BJP has fielded former deputy CM Govind Karjol from the central Karnataka seat. It was earlier held by minister of state (social justice) A Narayanaswamy. Both Narayanaswamy and Karjol belong to the Left subsect of the Scheduled Caste. BJP has fielded Karjol with the calculation that the Left voters, who are dominant, would back him. But, according to some partymen, Karjol has no local connect as he comes from the Mumbai-Karnataka region with a Kannada totally distinct from the way locals speak. Congress, on the other hand, has fielded a local, BN Chandrappa, also a member of the SC (Left).

Davanagere

Gayathri Siddeshwar, wife of sitting MP GM Siddeshwar, faced resistance from former MLAs including MP Renukacharya and SA Ravindranath.

Haveri

Former CM Basavaraj Bommai is fighting from Haveri. Sections of Panchamasalis, a dominant Lingayat subsect, are upset that he did not include them under the 2A category of reservation while in power. BJP is banking on the Modi factor in the district where five of the six assembly seats are held by Congress.

Dharwad

Union minister Pralhad Joshi has been quietly defending himself against a barrage of accusations by a local Lingayat mutt head, Dingalehswara Swami, who has also filed his papers as an independent candidate, much to the glee of the Congress.

Belagavi

Former CM Jagadish Shettar has taken on the young Congress candidate Mrinal Hebbalkar, the son of minister Lakshmi Hebbalkar. His relative, Mangala Angadi, the widow of former union minister of state Suresh Angadi, has stepped aside, but her own victory in the 2021 bypoll following her husband's death was by a margin of just about 5,000-odd votes. Shettar will have a lot of ground to cover here."

b'Two youths arrested for justifying Neha Hiremath's murder by Fayaz Khondunaik. Karnataka CM accused BJP of politicizing the murder. Accused's mother Mamtaz apologizes, demands strict punishment. Fayaz wanted to become an IAS officer and was a University Blue champion.Police have arrested two youths who justified the murder of Neha Hiremath, allegedly by Fayaz Khondunaik, on their social media handles, reported PTI.

The youths were arrested on Saturday after a few activists lodged a complaint alleging that the duo had posted contents claiming that Neha and Fayaz were in a relationship.

They allegedly uploaded pictures of the victim, Neha and the accused, Fayaz, with a caption, "Neha Fayaz true love, justice for love".

Neha Hiremath murder case

Neha Hiremath (23), daughter of Congress Councillor of Hubballi-Dharwad Municipal Corporation Niranjan Hiremath, was allegedly stabbed to death on the campus of BVB College on April 18. Neha was a first-year MCA student, and Fayaz was her former classmate.

The accused, Fayaz, who fled the scene, was arrested by police subsequently.

There have been protests in several parts of the state demanding capital punishment for Fayaz.

Political slugfest

The shocking murder has triggered a political slugfest in the state.

The BJP accused the Congress government of being soft on anti-social elements, which resulted in this incident as the ruling party tried to project it as an incident with a personal angle.

Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Saturday said that the murder of Congress corporator's daughter Neha Hiremath in Hubballi is not a case of "love jihad" as alleged by the BJP.

The Chief Minister, while speaking to the media, hit out at the BJP and accused the party of politicizing the murder for politics.

Condemning the incident, the CM said, "This is not a case of love jihad. I condemn the incident. We have arrested the culprit, the investigation is going on seriously and we will punish the culprit. We have taken care of law and order seriously to maintain peace and harmony. BJP is using this issue for politics, it is condemnable that a political party (BJP) is using the murder of a girl for political purposes."

Union Minister Pralhad Joshi, meanwhile, claimed that the case is of 'love jihad' but that the state government does not want to investigate the matter.

"He (deceased's father) is a corporator. For vote bank politics, suppressing and hushing up is their (Congress) policy. This is all happening due to that...There is a 'love jihad' but they do not want to investigate that. The father himself is saying that this is being hushed up," he said on Saturday.

"We hang our heads in shame": Fayaz's mother demands strict punishment for him

The mother of 23-year-old Fayaz, who allegedly killed daughter of a Congress councillor inside a college campus in Hubballi, apologised to the victim Neha's family for her son's act and demanded strict punishment for him.

With folded arms and tears in her eyes, the accused's mother Mamtaz, a teacher, said, "I apologise to the people of Karnataka as well as Neha's family for what my son has done. It is a great injustice to Neha and her family. "What my son has done is completely wrong, and we hang our heads in shame. What he did is a big mistake, and he should be given strict punishment as per the law of the land," she said.

Speaking to reporters in Dharwad, she said that her son and Neha were not just friends, but that they were in love and wanted to marry.

Recalling Neha as a good girl, Mamtaz said she came to know about their relationship a year ago.

"It was Neha who made the first move and took his phone number. My son did tell me about Neha and that he was in love with her, and they wanted to get married. But I had suggested that he first focus on his career. "My son was very brilliant and always secured above 90 percent marks since LKG and UKG days. He wanted to become an IAS officer and was also a University Blue (bodybuilding competition) champion," she said.

Meanwhile, former Karnataka Chief Minister Jagadish Shettar on Saturday visited the victim's family and offered condolences.

Condemning the incident, he said, "It was an inhumane act. The way Fayaz murdered Neha, it was inhumane. It is a condemnable act and I insist that the state government, Chief Minister and Home Minister conduct an impartial and speedy inquiry into the matter."

(With inputs from agencies)'

b'A 61.55% voter turnout marked the Lok Sabha elections' third phase in 93 constituencies across 11 states and Union Territories, with incidents of violence in West Bengal and notable participation by key political figures.A voter turnout of 61.55 per cent was recorded on Tuesday in the third phase of Lok Sabha elections in 93 constituencies spread over 11 states and Union Territories with stray incidents of violence in West Bengal. Assam recorded the highest turnout at 75.30 per cent followed by Goa at 74.32 per cent and West Bengal at 73.93 per cent, while Maharashtra witnessed the lowest at 54.98 per cent, with Bihar and Gujarat doing slightly better at 56.83 per cent, according to the figures from the Election Commission at 8 pm.

While the official time for voting to end is 6 pm, it can go beyond to enable voters who have come in the queue well before the end of fixed polling hours to exercise their franchise.

According to the EC, the figures are an "approximate" trend and are likely to rise as data was being collected.

Among other states, Uttar Pradesh recorded 57.34 per cent polling, Chhattisgarh 67.07 per cent, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu 65.23 per cent, Karnataka 68.14 per cent, and Madhya Pradesh 63.22 per cent, according to the EC.

As many as 17.24 crore people, including 8.39 crore females, were eligible to vote in the thirs phase and 1.85 lakh polling stations manned by 18.5 lakh officials had been set up.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah were among those who exercised their franchise in the state. While PM Modi cast his vote at a polling booth in Gandhinagar Lok Sabha constituency, Shah voted at a polling booth in Ahmedabad.

Shah (Gandhinagar) is among the bigwigs in the fray along with Union ministers Jyotiraditya Scindia (Guna), Mansukh Mandaviya (Porbandar), Parshottam Rupala (Rajkot), Pralhad Joshi (Dharwad) and SP Singh Baghel (Agra).

The stakes are high for the BJP in this round as it had won an overwhelming majority of these seats, including all in Gujarat, Karnataka and Madhya Pradesh, in the last election.

In Uttar Pradesh, where several members of Samajwadi Party patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav's family are contesting, party chief Akhilesh Yadav alleged that the BJP workers were trying to "loot booths" in Mainpuri and people from opposition parties were being detained in police stations.

Yadav cast his vote in Saifai (Etawah) in the Mainpuri constituency where his wife and sitting MP Dimple Yadav is contesting.

Sporadic incidents of violence marred the third phase of Lok Sabha polls in four constituencies in West Bengal as TMC, BJP and Congress-CPI(M) workers clashed with each other in various parts of Murshidabad and Jangipur seats.

According to state election officials, Murshidabad registered the highest voter turnout of 76.49 per cent followed by Maldaha Dakshin (73.68 pc), Maldaha Uttar (73.30 pc), and Jangipur (72.13 pc).

The TMC, BJP, and the Congress-CPI(M) alliance lodged separate complaints related to poll violence, voter intimidation, and assaults on poll agents.

The EC received 182 complaints by 9 am, most of which were from Murshidabad and Jangipur constituencies.

In Murshidabad seat, Left-Congress combine candidate Mohammed Salim claimed that he caught hold of a "fake booth agent" in the Rabinagar area of the constituency. Salim faced "go back" slogans as he tried to enter a booth there following allegations of CPI(M) booth agents being heckled by alleged TMC goons.

"The TMC has unleashed a reign of terror in the entire constituency. Strict action must be taken by the Election Commission," Salim said.

In the Karimpur area of the seat, clashes were reported between the TMC and the CPI(M) supporters outside a few booths. Clashes were reported between the TMC and the Congress activists from the Domkol area.

BJP candidate Dhanajoy Ghosh faced protests by TMC cadres in the Jangipur area as he tried to enter some of the booths in the constituency.

A scuffle broke out between Dhananjay Ghosh and TMC block president Goutam Ghosh, with both parties accusing each other of intimidating voters.

In the Englishbazar area in Maldaha Dakshin seat, the BJP accused the TMC of beating up their booth agents, similar complaints were lodged by the Congress against the state's ruling party from the Ratua area in Malda.

In some areas, TMC workers staged protests alleging that central forces were assisting BJP workers in "intimidating" voters at booths in the Maldaha North constituency.

In Uttar Pradesh, Agra witnessed 51.53 per cent polling, Aonla 54.73 per cent, Budaun 52.77 per cent, Bareilly 54.21 per cent, Etah 57.07 per cent, Fatehpur Sikri 54.93 per cent, Firozabad 56.27 per cent, Hathras 53.54 per cent, Mainpuri 55.88 per cent and Sambhal 61.10 per cent.

"In Mainpuri, BJP people are trying to loot booths. They are detaining opposition people in police stations," SP chief Yadav alleged without elaborating.

He also alleged rigging of votes at some places and said, "Information is coming from some places that the government is using force. It is heard that officers have been deployed outside polling booths."

In Budaun, the villagers of Dhoranpur boycotted the polling to protest against the alleged non-fulfilment of their demand for a road. District Magistrate Manoj Kumar said the issue has come to his notice and a sub-divisional magistrate (SDM) has been sent to the village.

Not a single vote was also cast in three villages of Firozabad -- Nagla Jawahar, Neem Kheria and Nagla Umar -- as the villagers tried to draw the administration's attention to their problems.

SP candidate Aditya Yadav in Budaun alleged that SP supporters were not being allowed to vote in some places.

"I have made a complaint in this regard with the EC observer and have given proof of police atrocities. We are only getting assurances," he said.

SP candidate Zia-ur-Rehman Barq also alleged that a circle officer snatched voter slips from SP workers and detained them. He requested the EC to remove the officer immediately.

Queues were seen at polling booths in most Lok Sabha segments in northern districts of Karnataka.

Union Minister Pralhad Joshi and Bhagwanth Khuba, and Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge were among those who came in early to cast their votes in Karnataka.

Former chief minister B S Yediyurappa along with sons B Y Raghavendra, BJP candidate from Shimoga Lok Sabha segment and B Y Vijayendra, party's state President -- and daughters-in-law cast their vote at Shikaripura in Shivamogga district.

Two government officials on poll duty died in Karnataka after suffering a heart attack, sources in the Election Commission said.

A 45-year-old woman polling officer - Kaushika Babariya- deployed at a polling booth in Amreli district of Gujarat, also died of a heart attack.

In Gujarat, the Banaskantha district collector ordered an inquiry after Congress Lok Sabha candidate Geniben Thakor alleged that electors were threatened and asked to vote for the BJP by some youngsters posing as Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel at a polling station.

In Maharashtra, Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, his wife Sunetra Pawar, who is the NCP candidate from the Baramati Lok Sabha seat, and NCP (SP) chief Sharad Pawar were among those who cast their votes.

Sharad Pawar was welcomed with a traditional 'aarti' as he arrived at a polling booth in the Malegaon area of Baramati constituency in Pune district.

Ajit Pawar and Sunetra Pawar cast their votes at a polling booth in Katewadi area of Baramati.

Sunetra is pitted against her sister-in-law Supriya Sule, Sharad Pawar's daughter and the sitting MP from there.

In Assam, people lined up in large numbers across four Lok Sabha constituencies to cast their vote.

Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma accompanied by his wife Riniki Bhuyan Sarma and daughter Sukanya Sarma exercised his franchise at Amingaon in Barpeta Lok Sabha seat.

People used all modes of transport, including boats, to reach the polling stations across Guwahati, Barpeta, Dhubri and Kokrajhar constituencies to exercise their democratic franchise amid rain.

Over 1,300 candidates, including around 120 women, are in the fray in the third phase.

Voting was completed in 189 seats out of 543 seats in the first two phases. The next four phases will be on May 13, May 20, May 25 and June 1. The counting of votes is on June 4.'

b'Fakira Dingaleshwar Swami, a prominent Veerashaiva Lingayat seer, announced his candidacy as an independent from the Dharwad Lok Sabha constituency. He accused BJP's candidate Pralhad Joshi of suppressing Veerashaiva-Lingayat and other communities. Swami criticized both BJP and Congress for neglecting the Dharwad constituency and announced his entry into politics to create political awareness. Joshi responded by stating that Swami's comments are blessings for him, and Yediyurappa has confirmed that Joshi will not be replaced.Fakira Dingaleshwar Swami of Shirahatti Fakkireshwar Math, a prominent Veerashaiva Lingayat seer, on Monday said he has decided to contest as an independent candidate from Dharwad segment in the upcoming Lok Sabha polls. Repeatedly targeting BJP's candidate from the segment and Union Minister Pralhad Joshi, he accused him of "suppressing" Veerashaiva-Lingayat and other communities, and also misusing of the Lingayat maths and causing disrespect to them to stay in power.

"I'm announcing my candidature as an independent candidate from the Dharwad Lok Sabha constituency. As you are aware the national parties have announced their candidates and people in the Dharwad constituency and nearby segments feel that both parties have entered into election fixing like match fixing," Dingaleshwar Swami alleged.

Responding to the Swami's decision, Joshi said: "There is no reaction to Dingaleshwar Swami...Whatever he says it is blessings for me."

The seer also accused Congress of neglecting Lingayats after coming to power, and not giving suitable positions to leaders of calibre from the community.

Speaking to reporters here, he accused both national parties of having betrayed the people of the Dharwad constituency.

"While the two parties have fielded their candidates, voters of Dharwad have decided to field me as their candidate. This is a 'Dharma Yuddha' declared by those who value their dignity and 'Kaavidhaaris', against two national parties and selfish politicians," the swami said, adding, he is entering politics to create political awareness among people.

"There should be no politics in 'Dharma' and there should be 'Dharma' in politics -- is the desire of the people, and I will continue this even after the polls," he said, adding that his "Dharma Yuddha" will continue till the end of his life in favour of oppressed communities and their leaders.

A few seers in the Dharwad region, especially those from Lingayat community, met in Hubballi on March 27 under the leadership of Dingaleshwar Swami and asked BJP central leadership to change the party's Dharwad Lok Sabha candidate Prahlad Joshi. They had given the party time till March 31 to decide.

At that meeting it was decided that "like in the north", Swamijis in the south too should work in the political field and contest elections.

Lingayats are said to be the majority among voters in the Dharwad segment, while Joshi, a four-time MP, is a Brahmin.

Targeting Joshi, the Union Minister for Parliamentary Affairs, Coal and Mines, the seer alleged on Monday: "in oppressing leaders from other communities, Joshi is a hero, but when it comes to development, he is zero, and this is among the reasons for me to contest the election."

He asked as to what Joshi has done during his 20 years tenure as MP, to the constituency and the state.

Joshi on his part has been maintaining that he will consider the seer's comments as a blessing and will try to clarify the misunderstandings, if any, in the days ahead, while veteran BJP leader B S Yediyurappa, a Lingayat stalwart, has categorically said there is no question of replacing Joshi.

To a question about his well wishers and supporters targeting the seer, Joshi said: "I have no comments, social media is an open platform and people there comment in our favour, also against us. I'm a party candidate, I will not comment on such things."

Karnataka goes to Lok Sabha polls in two phases and voting will be held for Dharwad in the second phase on May 7.

Claiming that BJP did not give tickets to various communities like Kuruba, Reddy, Ambigas and Lambanis, the Swami pointed out that veteran BJP leader K S Eshwarappa's son K E Kantesh too was denied ticket from Haveri, and he was "betrayed". "I had warned Eshwarappa not to trust Joshi."

He alleged that BJP denied opportunity to leaders from several big communities to contest, but has given three tickets to those from the community that has very less population (Brahmins -- Pralhad Joshi, Tejasvi Surya -Bangalore South, and Vishweshwara Hegde Kageri-Uttara Kannada), and asked: "where is social justice?"

However, claiming that he was not anti-Brahmin, he also said that several people from Joshi's community have contacted him, extending their support.'

b'Hubballi: Pralhad Joshi will file nomination on April 15. The procession will start by garlanding the Shivaji statue, and hundreds of party workers will take part in the procession. Union minister Pralhad Joshi said that former chief minister BS Yeddiyurappa and other party brass will participate in the programme. Planning is on and very soon other details will be declared, he added.While replying to a query, Joshi said there is no need to give importance to statements by Rahul Gandhi, as his launch will not be successful. TNN'

b'Belagavi/Hubballi: Laxmi Hebbalkar, the women and child welfare minister, accused the BJP leadership of shielding JD(S) MP Prajwal Revanna in the sex scandal case for political gain. She urged the BJP leaders to clarify their stance on the scandal and whether they will continue their alliance with JD(S), despite the exposure of such a huge scandal.

During a press conference in Belagavi on Monday, Hebbalkar said the scandal is shameful for both the state and the country."I am getting enquiries from all over the country and also from abroad," she said.

Hebbalkar alleged that the BJP leadership formed an alliance with JD(S) for political benefit, despite being aware of the scandal well in advance. She pointed out that in December, Devraj Gowda, a BJP leader from Hassan, had informed BJP state president BY Vijayendra about the scandal through a letter. Additionally, former BJP MLAs Preetam Gowda and RT Ramaswamy had brought the matter to the attention of Union home minister Amit Shah.

"Several girls and women, from the age of 16 to 60 have faced sexual harassment of MP Prajwal Revanna. This includes police officials and anganwadi workers, apart from SC/ST women, labourers and maids. PM Narendra Modi is talking about the protection of mangalasutras of Hindu women. Do these women are not Hindus? What about their mangalasutras? PM should speak about it," Hebbalkar called upon.

Hebbalkar challenged the BJP to demonstrate their commitment to the slogan 'Beti Bachao Beti Padhao' by agitating against the harassment of these women in all taluks and districts, without showing double standards, as they protested after the murder of Neha Hiremath in Hubballi. She also called upon opposition leader R Ashoka to clarify BJP's political stand on the scandal, instead of evading the question by saying, 'JD(S) leaders will answer on it'. Similarly, she asked HD Kumaraswamy to reveal his clear stand instead of making a vague statement 'who eats salt must drink water'.

Hebbalkar said she has discussed the scandal in detail with CM Siddaramaiah, following which the govt has handed over the case to SIT. She assured that the names of the girls and women, who complained to SIT would be kept confidential. Hebbalkar also demanded that the Union govt to bring back the accused Prajwal using Interpol, as he has fled abroad.

Prajwal's

case won't

affect NDA: Joshi

Union minister Pralhad Joshi has commented that Prajwal Revanna's case won't cause any setback for NDA candidates in LS elections in the state. Joshi pressed for punishment for offenders. "Anyway, Congress is in power in the state. Let them act against offenders as per the law," he added.'

b'Haveri/Bagalkot/Belagavi: On Friday, the last day of nomination filing, Basavaraj Bommai, BJP candidate in the Haveri Lok Sabha and former CM, filed his nomination papers accompanied by his son Bharath Bommai and supporters before returning officer and DC Raghunandan Murthy.

He had filed his nomination papers earlier along with party office bearers and leaders.On Friday, former CM BS Yediyurappa, Union parliament affairs and coal & mines minister Pralhad Joshi, MP Shivakumar Udasi, former minister CC Patil, BC Patil, film actors Tara Anuradha, MLA Arvind Bellad and others accompanied Bommai in a massive rally. Haveri and Gadag district'sBJP and JD(S) workers took part in the rally, which was a show of strength

After nominations were filed, a massive rally was started from Hukkeri Math to Valmiki Circle via the main streets of the city. BJP candidate sought blessings from Hukkeri Mutt seer Sadashiva Swamiji before the rally. Party workers, followers, and elected representatives participated in the rally, waving the party flag.

"Prime Minister Narendra Modi should come to power the third time by winning 400 plus seats in this parliamentary election. Following this, I must win this parliament election; I will represent this constituency strongly. I took a historic decision by hiking the reservation quota during my tenure for all communities, but Congress held up this because these people don't want to welfare of Dalits and Adivasi people,"charged BJP candidate Basavaraj Bommai. Addressing the rally, he appealed to the people to extend their support to him.

Former CM BS Yediyurappa appealed to the people to make Bommai victorious with more than 2 lakh votes in this election. "BJP and JD(S) workers should strive until Bommai wins. PM Modi and former PM HD Devegowda committed to work together in this election, so party workers should work for the party candidate jointly"he advised.

Union minister Pralhad Joshi appealed to the party workers that people should boycott the political party leaders who were boycotting the inauguration of Sri Ram Mandir in Ayodhya."People should remove the party that raised Pakistan Zindabad slogan," he added.

Huge procession for Samyuktha Patil

Congress candidate for Bagalkot Lok Sabha seat Samyuktha Patil filed her nomination papers on Friday. She arrived in a huge procession from Sakri College ground to the deputy commissioner's office, accompanied by ministers Satish Jarkiholi, RB Timmapur, Shivanand Patil, HK Patil and present and former legislators from Bagalkot district.

Veena Kashappanavar, who is unhappy at being denied the ticket, joined the procession a little later.

Samyuktha, daughter of sugar minister Shivanand Patil, submitted four sets of nomination papers to district election officer and deputy commissioner KM Janaki.

HK Patil slams BJP

Law and parliamentary affairs minister HK Patil accused the BJP of playing with the sentiments of people by raising religious and communal issues, while the Congress was concerned about serious problems like poverty, unemployment and price rise faced by crores of people.

Speaking to reportersin Bagalkot on Friday, he said Prime Minister Narendra Modi and home minister Amit Shah had ridiculed the Congress' five guarantees, but the Congress had fulfilled its promises after coming to power in Karnataka. He said BJP's efforts in ensuring speedy progress on Upper Krishna Project was nothing when compared to that of the Congress govt.

MC Charantimath joins Congress

Mallikarjun Charantimath, brother of former BJP MLA Veeranna Charantimath, joined Congress in Bagalkot on Friday. Mallikarjun had contested as an independent against his brother in the 2023 assembly elections from Bagalkot assembly constituency and lost. Sources said Mallikarjun was keen to join BJP but some leaders in the saffron party opposed it.'

b'Belagavi: Addressing a press conference in Belagavi on Sunday, law and parliamentary affairs minister HK Patil strongly denounced the decision of the Union ministry of environment, forests and climate change to postpone the clearance of the Mahadayi water project. The issue was deferred during a meeting chaired by the Union forest minister in February.

"This is a huge injustice to the people of Karnataka by the Modi govt.The state govt is eagerly waiting for clearance from the Ministry of environment, forests and climate change to start the Mahadayi project, following the order by the Mahadayi Water Dispute Tribunal. By deferring the clearance to Mahadayi, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has become 'vachanabhrashta' and has lost the moral right to seek votes of the people of Karnataka," he said.

Patil criticised PM Modi for claiming to resolve the Mahadayi issue during the assembly elections and attempting to take credit for it. He accused the PM of lying to the people of Karnataka.

The minister also criticised former CM BS Yediyurappa and Union minister Pralhad Joshi for misleading the public. He alleged that Yediyurappa presented a false unsigned letter from the Goa govt stating that they had no objection to the Mahadayi water project, while Joshi tweeted about resolving the long-standing issue and took credit for it, with BJP workers even distributing sweets. However, Patil pointed out that the central government has still not issued clearance to start the project.

According to Patil, the Modi govt has done a great disservice to North Karnataka by keeping the Mahadayi issue in limbo and failing to publish the gazetteer on the Upper Krishna project for the past 10 years. This has prevented the state govt from undertaking works at Upper Krishna. He accused BJP leaders of trying to conceal these issues from the public.'

b'Dharwad: Janata Dal (Secular) cadre will actively campaign for Union minister Pralhad Joshi, the BJP candidate for Dharwad constituency, said president of JD(S) Hubballi-Dharwad City unit Gururaj Hunashimarad.

Speaking to reporters here on Sunday, he said JD(S) entered into an alliance with BJP in the interest of the nation's security and development and the workers will respect the decision of the party high command."We will sincerely work for Joshi and ensure his victory with a record margin," Hunashimarad said.

Responding to Dingaleshwar swami of Fakir mutt entering the fray to 'defeat Prahlad Joshi', president of the District (Rural) JD(S) Committee BB Gangadharmath said religious heads should confine themselves to religious activities and should stay away from electoral politics. "Devotees of Fakir mutt have different political affiliations and the religious heads taking a political stand hurts the sentiments of the devotees," he said.

Former MLA Veerabhadrappa Halaharavi, who joined JD(S) from BJP before the 2023 assembly elections, hailed the development works that have been taken up in the constituency under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union minister Pralhad Joshi. "Joshi will win again and Modi will become the PM," he said.'

b'Dharwad/Hubballi/Belagavi: Rich tributes were paid to the architect of the Indian Constitution Dr BR Ambedkar on his 133rd birth anniversary by the district administrations, various local organisations and educational institutions across North Karnataka on Sunday.

Political functionaries made a beeline to garland the statue of Dr Ambedkar in front of Kadapa Maidan in Dharwad.DC Divya Prabhu, police commissioner Renuka Sukumar, SP Gopal Byakod and other senior officers were present. As the model code of conduct for LS polls is in force, the district administration held the event at DC's office. Deputy commissioner Divya Prabhu, additional deputy commissioner Geeta CD and local leaders offered floral tributes to Dr Ambedkar's portrait.

At the University of Agricultural Sciences, the staff and students celebrated the occasion by offering puja to a portrait of Dr Ambedkar. UAS registrar Jayalaxmi Raikod, vice-chancellor PL Patil, Professor VI Benagi and others were present.

The students and teachers of Rashtrotthana Vidyakendra also celebrated the birth anniversary and a special talk on Dr Ambedkar was delivered. School principal Anita Rai presided.

At Karnataka Vidyavardhakh Sangha, Lohit Naikar and Basavaprabhu Hoskeri delivered special talks on 'Ambedkar and Social Justice'. KVS president Chandrakanth Bellad, general secretary Shankar Halgatti and others were present.

Cine actor L Ashok called upon young researchers to shed more light on the social and economic policies of Dr Ambedkar, while inaugurating a seminar organised by the Dr BR Ambedkar Research Chair at Karnatak University.

Professor PK Yavagal, principal of Govt College, Nigadi, speaking during an event at Dharwad Jilla Kannada Sahitya Parishat, hailed Dr Ambedkar as the champion of the downtrodden.

Hailed in Hubballi

Union minister Pralhad Joshi, former CM Basavaraj Bommai, MLA Prasad Abbayya, Fakir Dingaleshwar Mahaswamiji, HDMC commissioner Ishwar Ullagaddi and others paid floral tribute to the idol of Dr Ambedkar here on Sunday.

Joshi said Dr BR Ambedkar was a great person who advocated equal rights."We must pay a real tribute to him by bringing social equality, a society without untouchability and a Viksit Bharat. The country will always remember him. Despite going through much pain, he worked withoutbias during the Constitution making process," he added.

Bommai said that Ambedkar must be called as Mahatma Ambedkar. "Govts may change but their smooth functioning has been ensured by Ambedkar," he added.

Dingaleshwar Swamiji said that some people are trying to change the principles of the Constitution. "Elected representatives, who tried to trample Ambedkar and Valmiki, will be removed in future," he said.

MLA Prasad Abbayya said that Anantkumar Hegde and MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal were elected as per the provisions of the constitution formed by Ambedkar, but they are giving out statements on changing the Constitution. "They will lose their political status if they touch the Constitution," he lashed out.

Across Belagavi district

Dr BR Ambedkar Jayanti was celebrated in a grand manner across Belagavi district on Sunday. As part of the programme, a procession led by deputy commissioner Nitesh Patil was organised by the Belagavi district administration from Sambhaji Circle to Ambedkar Garden. After welcoming the Jyoti at Ambedkar Garden, DC Patil garlanded the statue of Babasaheb Ambedkar. Police commissioner Dr Martin Marbanyang, ZP CEO Rahul Shinde, district superintendent of police Dr Bhima Shankar Guleda, leaders of various Dalit organisations were present. Several top officials garlanded the statue of Ambedkar on the premises of Buddha Vihar in Sadashiva Nagar. Many officials and community leaders were also present.'

b'Hubballi: Members of Congress party, led by Karnataka Pradesh Youth Congress state president Mohammed Nalapad, staged a protest and expressed outrage against Hassan MP Prajwal Revanna in the sleaze pen drive case, at Ambedkar Circle on Monday. After burning his effigy, Nalapad said Prajwal has a perverted mind, and action should be taken against him."JD(S) and BJP helped Prajwal escape to a foreign country. None is raising a voice about his act. We will question Prime Minister Modi, home ministerAmit Shah, Union minister Pralhad Joshi about Prajwal\'s case. Due to BJP-JD(S) alliance, they are not talking about the incident," he alleged.\n\nSpeaking on the recent murder of Neha Hiremath, Nalapad said accused Fayaz should be punished. TNN'

b'Hubballi: Many elected representatives of NK region mourned the death of BJP MP V Srinivasa Prasad. Union minister Pralhad Joshi in his condolence message that Srinivasa Prasad was a strong voice of Dalits and his death has created a vacuum in the society.

"Being an MP for long period, he was a progressive politician who took up various development works and initiatives," he added.

Former CM Basavaraj Bommai said that Srinivasa Prasad has contributed much to the state during his political career spanning about 50 years as an MLA, MP and even as a minister. "We have lost a guide and a senior leader," he added.

Basavaraj Horatti, chairman, Karnataka Legislative Council, recalled that Srinivasa Prasad entered politics in 1974 and was MP for 4 times and MLA for 6 times. "He was a value-oriented politician," he termed.'

b'HUBBALLI: The brutal killing of MCA student Neha Hiremath on BVB campus of KLE Technological University on Thursday sparked an outrage in many districts of north Karnataka, with thousands of students and shocked citizens filling the funeral route in Hubballi on Friday.

The 24-year-old was hacked to death by Fayaz Kondunaik, 24, who claimed to be her former friend, as she had been avoiding him despite his attempts to interact with her.

Doctors at KIMS Hospital, where Neha was brought dead on Thursday, said her body bore 10 stab wounds.

Police commissioner Renuka Sukumar said the accused, who is from Munavalli in Belagavi district, had been remanded in judicial custody. Many politicians and organisations, including Anjuman-e-Islam of Hubballi, demanded speedy trial and death sentence to the accused.

The deceased student was laid to rest at Budnal in a moving ceremony that left none of the attendees dry-eyed. District minister Santosh Lad, MLA Prasad Abbayya and Dingaleshwar Swamiji, the head of a prominent mutt, were among thousands present at the cremation.

Lad, however, cautioned against politicising the issue, saying such incidents had occurred in the past, too. The minister's remarks came after Union minister Pralhad Joshi alleged that the Congress govt in Karnataka had failed on the law and order front.

Earlier, Neha's father Niranjan Hiremath told Joshi that Hindu girls were being targeted, and said there's "an entrenched system" behind such incidents.

"We should put an end to this," he said. On Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah's statement that "personal reason" was likely behind the murder, Hiremath said Kondunaik was neither "his relative nor had any transactional ties with him".

Students from many schools and colleges forged a human chain on Hubballi-Dharwad road, throwing traffic out of gear for several hours. Police commissioner Renuka Sukumar reached the spot and pacified the angry protesters, saying the accused had been arrested and investigations were going on.'

b'Hubballi: NDA govt has given 40% more funds to Karnataka as compared to the UPA govt, claimed Union minister Pralhad Joshi.\n\nSpeaking to reporters, Joshi said, "Modi govt has released 51% of grants to the state in the last 10 years. It has given Rs 30,951 crore of drought relief funds and Rs 11,482 crore of NDRF funds. The UPA govt had given Rs 15,541 crore between 2009 and 2013.They had given just Rs 3,500 crore under NDRF funds against the total demand of Rs 44,638 crore. The UPA govt had given just 10-11% but NDA gave 51%. There was no need for state govt to approach the Supreme Court, but it was a drama enacted in the wake of Lok Sabha polls."TNN'

b'Hubballi: Fakir Dingaleshwar swamiji (in pic) has alleged that Union minister Pralhad Joshi is creating a tussle, between him and his senior pontiff Fakir Siddharam Mahaswamiji.

On Saturday, swamiji told reporters that Joshi has met Fakir Siddharam swamiji, senior pontiff of Fakireshwar Sansthan Mutt Shirahatti during the election campaign to create a tussle.

"When our senior pontiff had tried to contact Joshi after becoming Union minister, he had never received seer's calls and never tried to meet him. He uses Lingayat mutts, seers and Lingayats at large only during the election. He is applying vibhuti on the foreheads of Lingayat seers and giving envelop to them and we have videos of the same. He is putting used shawls on seers. Despite all these dramas, he has been suppressing Lingayats for 20 years," he lamented.

He also said that he withdrew his nomination as per the instruction of his senior pontiff. He also said that Joshi is trying to divide guru and shishya. He warned that if Joshi continues the same, his personal relationships may be affected. "He even utilised Neha Hiremath's murder for his political gains. It means he utilises the death of Lingayats for his mileage," he lashed out. He urged his supporters, even those working in the BJP, to defeat Joshi in the LS election.'

b'Hubballi: Implementing Mahadayi River water project is my next aim and responsibility, said Union minister Pralhad Joshi.

Campaigning at Tolanakere Park here on Saturday, Joshi said that he has taken Dharwad district on the path of progress in a decade by bringing national highway, upgraded railway station, KIMS building, Airport, Malaprabha drinking water supply and other schemes and projects.

"I will not do politics like Congressmen in implementing Mahadayi project," he added. MLA Mahesh Tenginkai, Mayor Veena Baradwad and other BJP functionaries were present on the occasion.'

b"BENGALURU: With the curtains falling on the first phase of elections, attention now turns to the electoral showdown across 14 Lok Sabha constituencies in north and central Karnataka, slated for May 7.

This second phase promises a gripping contest as key political figures such as Union minister Pralhad Joshi, former minister B Sriramulu, and AICC president Mallikarjun Kharge's son-in-law, Radhakrishna Doddamani, are in the fray. BJP and Congress will engage in a direct fight in all 14 seats, since JD(S) -- BJP's ally -- had opted out, an admission of its minimal influence in the region.

Congress has intensified its campaign, with CM Siddaramaiah taking centre stage. He addressed rallies in Bidar, Haveri, and Dharwad on Thursday, while former Congress president Rahul Gandhi held rallies in Vijayapura and Ballari on Friday. Sources say Rahul is slated to make at least two more appearances.

BJP is also leaving no stone unturned. Party president JP Nadda recently held a roadshow in Surapura and Kalaburagi, rallying support for Umesh Jadhav, who defeated Kharge in 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to address rallies in Belgaum, Uttara Kannada, Davanagere, Ballari, and Bagalkot Lok Sabha seats on Sunday.

BJP had won all 14 seats in 2019 and is determined to retain them. But it has a stiff challenge on its hands. It traditionally garners support from Lingayats, Marathas, and a section of Scheduled Castes, but in assembly elections last year, Congress managed to secure substantial support from the Lingayat community.

Congress, given a changed political scenario, now faces a challenge of retaining Lingayat votes, while also appealing to Ahinda groups and minorities, its traditional vote banks. Besides winning back support of Lingayats, BJP must also counter Congress' five guarantees.

BJP's success in 2019 adds to the pressure, but the popularity of PM Modi among Lingayats and youth demographics offers some reassurances.

These polls are significant for figures such as Mallikarjun Kharge and former CM BS Yediyurappa. Kharge must ensure Congress wins more seats in his stronghold of Kalyana Karnataka to maintain his standing within the party.

Victory for BJP would help Yediyurappa and his son BY Vijayendra, BJP state chief, to consolidate their position."

b'Belagavi/Dharwad/Haveri/Chikodi/Vijayapura: On Monday, Mrinal Hebbalkar, the Congress candidate and son of women and child welfare minister Laxmi Hebbalkar, submitted his nomination for the Belgaum Lok Sabha seat. Accompanied by deputy CM DK Shivakumar, public works minister Satish Jarkiholi, his mother Laxmi Hebbalkar and several MLAs and MLCs, Mrinal filed his nomination papers.

Meanwhile, Jagadish Shettar, the BJP candidate and former CM, also filed his nomination along with former minister Ramesh Jarkiholi, current MP Mangala Angadi, and MLC Hanamant Nirani.Shettar plans to file another set of nomination papers on April 17, accompanied by a large rally.

Before filing his nomination, Mrinal Hebbalkar sought blessings from more than 20 Lingayat seers from various mutts at his Kuvempu Nagar residence. Basavajaya Mrutyunjay Swamiji of Kudalasangama Peetha, Chandrashekhar Shivacharya Swamiji of Hukkeri, Gurusiddha Swamiji of Karanjimath were present. Subsequently, the Hebbalkar family conducted a puja at the Hindalaga Ganapati temple.

During the event, Laxmi Hebbalkar expressed confidence in her son Mrinal's victory, predicting a lead of over 2 lakh votes. She emphasized that this election is a matter of pride for Belagavi, as a native son is contesting against an outsider.

Will file nomination on April 18: Priyanka Jarkiholi

Priyanka Jarkiholi, Congress candidate from Chikkodi Lok Sabha constituency, said she will file nomination papers on April 18 in a simple manner, accompanied by few leaders and followers. Speaking to the media on Monday at Chikodi, Priyanka clarified: "As my father and minister Satish Jarkiholi told me to ensure that workers and the general public are not disturbed due to a huge rally in the scorching sun, I decided to submit my nomination in a simple manner accompanied by a few party brass and followers."

Joshi seeks fifth term

Union minister Pralhad Joshi, the BJP candidate for Dharwad Lok Sabha constituency, filed his nomination papers here on Monday, seeking a fifth consecutive term in Parliament. Joshi has been representing this constituency since 2004.

Prior to filing his papers, Joshi garlanded the statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji and came to the DC's office in a grand procession in which about 50,000 of his supporters and party workers participated.

Earlier, he visited the Raghavendra Swamy Mutt at Bhavani Nagar, Moorusavir Mutt, Siddaroodh Mutt in Hubballi, Narasimha Temple in Gandhi Chowk in Dharwad and Murugha Mutt and sought the blessings of the almighty.

He was accompanied in the procession by former chief ministers BS Yediyurappa, Jagadish Shettar, Basavaraj Bommai, former MPs Vijay Sankeshwar, Prabhakar Kore, MLAs Arvind Bellad, MR Patil, Mahesh Tenginakai, former minister Shankar Patil Munenkopp, former MLAs Amrut Desai, Veerabhadrappa Halaharavi and other functionaries.

Joshi, accompanied by advocate Arun Joshi, submitted four sets of nomination papers to the returning officer and DC Divya Prabhu.

Later, speaking to reporters, Joshi expressed confidence of winning the election with a record margin. He said along with his performance in the House as well as his contribution to the development projects in the constituency, people's faith in BJP and Prime Minister Narendra Modi's ability to take India forward will make his victory with huge margin easy.

Bommai said Joshi will win with a record margin as people have tremendous faith in him and BJP led by PM Modi. "There is an attempt to create confusion among voters by spreading false narratives about Joshi and people of the constituency by participating in huge numbers voluntarily in the procession today have given a befitting reply to those trying to mislead them," Bommai said.

Will speak about Modi's achievements: Bommai

I will inform people about the achievements of his government, along with Prime Minister Narendra Modi's contributions to the people, said Basavaraj Bommai, former CM and BJP candidate for Haveri Lok Sabha constituency.

Speaking to reporters after filing nomination papers here on Monday, Bommai said two sets of the nomination papers were filed on Monday, "which is very auspicious day". "Another set of papers will be filed on April 19 after taking out a mega procession to be attended by former CM BS Yediyurappa, and other. I will win by a big margin," he claimed.

On Modi's campaign in the state, Bommai said the PM will tour north Karnataka region on April 25 or 26.

Jolle, 2 others file papers for Chikkodi LS seat

Three candidates, including BJP's Annasaheb Jolle filed their nomination papers in Chikkodi Lok Sabha constituency on Monday.

Sitting MP Jolle, who arrived at Mini Vidhana Soudha in Chikodi without any procession or rally, submitted his candidature once again as the BJP candidate. Raibag MLA Duryodhan Aihole, former minister Shrimant Patil, former MLA Mahesh Kumathalli, Chikkodi BJP in-charge and MLC PH Pujar accompanied him. Returning Officer and ZP CEO Rahul Sindhe received the papers.

Appasaheba Kurane of Sarva Janata Party and Vilas Mannur, an independent candidate, also submitted nomination papers separately to returning officer Rahul Sindhe.

Raju Alagur files

nomination in Vijayapura

The Vijayapura Congress candidate Raju Alagur filed his nomination papers on Monday. Earlier, he arrived in a mega procession that started from Siddeshwar temple here. Thousands of supporters joined in the rally and raised slogans for change in Vijayapura. Lambani women danced to traditional songs. Various folk teams attracted passers-by with their performances.

Addressing the crowd, minister MB Patil said that Modi's lies are now being recognised by people and claimed Modi gave 'bure din' instead of 'achche din' to the nation. "Congress built the nation but it never tried to divide people," he added.

Another minister Shivanand Patil said that Congress has already proved its commitment in fulfilling guarantees in Karnataka and it will do the same in the nation. MLAs Yashawantarayagouda Patil, Vitthal Katakadonda, CS Nadagouda (Appaji), Ashok Managuli, Prakash Rathod and others spoke.'

b'Haveri/Gadag: Chief minister Siddaramaiah called upon the voters to defeat Union minister and BJP's Lok Sabha candidate Pralhad Joshi, who he said justified the betrayal of the tax money to the people of the state by the Centre.

He was speaking after inaugurating the Prajadhwani-2 Yatra in Tadas Cross of Shiggaon taluk on Thursday, which was organised to seek votes for Vinod Asooti, the Congress candidate for the Hubballi-Dharwad Lok Sabha constituency."In the past 10 years, Pralhad Joshi has not questioned the injustice to the state by PM Narendra Modi even once. The state was also given a raw deal by the 15th Finance Commission," CM Siddaramaiah said and asked whether people's votes were respected by Pralhad Joshi, who did not question the central government that did not release grants even when there was a severe drought and did not even speak up on behalf of the people of the state.

CM Siddaramaiah further said even when there is such a severe drought in the state, the central government has not released a single rupee for drought relief from the share of Karnataka state. "Union minister Pralhad Joshi represents the state but to no avail. If you defeat him and send him home, your vote will be respected. Vinod Asooti, a young gentleman, who is kind-hearted and has a secular mindset who cares about society, will win this time. People's blessings are needed for his victory," Siddaramaiah appealed.

District minister Santosh Lad, former minister Vinay Kulkarni, Lok Sabha candidate Vinod Asooti and MLAs of the district were present.

In Gadag, Siddaramaiah criticised BJP nominee for Haveri segment, Basavaraj Bommai, saying he had done no development in the constituency when he was the CM. "So Congress candidate Anandaswamy Gaddadevarmath will win with more than one lakh margin of votes," he said. He also charged PM Narendra Modi with visiting the state only during elections. "The PM neither brought back black money from foreign countries, nor distributed Rs 15 lakh to everyone, as he claimed in his first election campaign. The PM has also failed to create two crore jobs every year," he said.'

b"Dharwad: The Election Commission of India has given symbols for the candidates in fray for the Dharwad Lok Sabha constituency. Deputy commissioner Divya Prabhu GRJ who is the district returning officer gave the symbols to the independent candidates.\n\nWhile BJP nominee and union minister Pralhad Joshi who is seeking a fifth term has BJP's symbol Lotus, Congress candidate Vinod Asuti's symbol is Hand."

b'Hubballi: A group of Muslim community leaders visited the residence of MCA student late Neha Hiremath, who was murdered by her former classmate on college campus, and extended their solidarity to the family on Sunday.

A delegation of Anjuman-E-Islam Hubballi comprising former minister AM Hindasgeri, Altaf Hallur and others condemned the incident and assured of their efforts to get severe punishment for the accused.They said they would appeal to the Chief Justice of India, Human Rights Commission and other agencies to punish the accused in the interest of society.

Meanwhile, Niranjan Hiremath has demanded the arrest of Fayaz Kondunaik's parents on charges of provoking Neha to get converted to Islam, on Sunday. Hiremath, a Congress corporator, said: "They are spreading photos of Neha and Fayaz on social media. Those photos were taken at college functions. I have learnt that Fayaz's parents told their son to bring Neha or else kill her. I will file a complaint against them," he added.

Yuva Brigade founder Chakraravthy Sulibele visited the family on Saturday evening and termed Neha's case the most severe among love jihad cases. "The state govt should accept it as a love jihad case. CM, DCM and other ministers should stop issuing irresponsible statements about the case. They should frame a law in Neha's name to punish those harassing women severely, on the lines of Uttar Pradesh," he pressed.

A group of Muslim friends of Niranjan Hiremath visited the family and said they would demand severe punishment for the boy. They recalled their friendship with Niranjan since childhood and said they stood with the family. Niranjan replied that he was not blaming the whole community for one person's crime. His Muslim neighbours have also denied that Neha had an affair. "We knew her since childhood. She was not a girl who would fall in love with someone. The culprit should be hanged till his death," they demanded.

Meanwhile, sources in Dharwad district jail have revealed that Fayaz allegedly said he murdered Neha as she was avoiding and refusing to talk to him.

Union minister Pralhad Joshi told reporters that the state govt is in favour of love jihad and Congress may plunge into any level for vote-bank politics. "CM and his ministers are talking irresponsibly though the daughter of a Congress corporator has been murdered. What if a commoner's daughter was murdered?" he questioned.

Police commissioner Renuka Sukumar has felicitated the team which arrested the accused man Fayaz Kondunaik within an hour of the murder, with the award of 'Cop of the Month' and a cash prize of Rs 25,000. "As soon as the incident was reported, we formed a team involving Hubballi North ACP Shivaprakash Naik and Vidyanagar police inspector DK Patil. The team coordinated and secured the accused within an hour of the offence," Sukumar said in a press release.'

b"Hubballi: On the occasion of Jatra Mahaotsav in Alnavar, a team of like-minded youths organising international level 'Nikali Kusthi' competition on May 12. Sharing details with reporters here on Monday, event organiser Raju Pejolli said that over 225 national and international-level wrestlers will participate in the competition.

Bharat Kesri Jassa Patti, Maharashtra Kesri, Sikhandar Shaikh, international wrestler Mirza, Rijha, Mubeen from Iran, famed wrestlers Shivaraj Rashake, Bola from Punjab, Sadashiv Nalavade, Kartik Kate, Rohan, Shalina Siddi and many more wrestlers will take part, he added.Winners in different wrestling matches will be given cash prizes from Rs 2,500 to 12 lakh and silver mementos.

Union minister Pralhad Joshi, minister Santosh Lad, former minister RV Deshpande and others will attend the inauguration. Seer of Maratha community Swami Manjunath Bharatiya of Gosaimath in Bengaluru will attend the programme, he added. Sitting arrangements will be made for over 30,000. Arrangements are being made and the wrestling matches will be held near APMC in Alnavar, he said. TNN"

b"Hubballi: Karnataka's polls so far have witnessed the election of 174 Lok Sabha members from 28 constituencies between 1951 and 2019. Among these, only four have achieved the remarkable feat of being elected seven times, with 13 serving for five or more terms.

Vijayapura MP Ramesh Jigajinagi, already a six-time MP, is set to join the prestigious seven-time club if he wins in the upcoming election.

Jigajinagi has also served as an MLA twice in 1983 and 1994 at Ballolli constituency. He was minister of state for home and excise between 1983 to 1985. He was revenue minister between 1996 and 1998. In the Centre, he was minister of state for drinking water and sanitation in Narendra Modi govt between 2016 and 2019.

Bagalkot MP PC Gaddigoudar as well as Union minister Pralhad Joshi and both vying for their fifth consecutive terms, aspire to secure their places in Karnataka's five-time Lok Sabha members' league. PC Gaddigoudar was an MLC from Bijapur Local Authorities between 1988 to 1994. Joshi was defeated by HK Patil in the MLC election in 1996. Both entered Lok Sabha in 2004 and are now contesting for the fifth consecutive time from the BJP."

b'Hubballi: Dingaleshwar Swamiji of Bhavaikyata Peetha in Shirahatti, Gadag district, intends to relocate to Hubballi. In a couple of days, the seer will be a resident of Hubballi.

As an independent candidate in the parliamentary election, he seeks to challenge Union minister Pralhad Joshi, alleging suppression of Lingayat and other community leaders.

Swamiji's supporters have identified several houses in Hubballi for his consideration, reflecting his commitment to accessibility by opting for rental accommodation to be closer to his followers, devotees, and voters.

Over the past few days, the number of visitors has increased because of the announcement by Swamiji about his participation in electoral politics. After visiting various villages, Swamiji used to return to Shirahatti mutt for rest and his daily religious performances.

However, now, because of the seer's busy schedule and increasing inconvenience to the devotees and followers to meet him, Swamiji has decided to stay in Hubballi in a rented house. According to sources, a few houses have been identified, but Swamiji has to finalise.

Mahantesh, a follower of the seer, said Swamiji wanted to stay in Hubballi in the interest of hundreds of devotees, followers and voters. For the past two or three days, various rented houses were checked, keeping the convenience of people at large.

Swamiji's followers are looking for a house where more people can gather, and take rest in the afternoon. Due to increasing summer heat, visitors, especially from neighbouring villages, are finding it very difficult to meet the seer.

Dingaleshwar Swamiji of Bhavaikyata Peetha, Shirahatti, said finding a house in Hubballi is the need of the hour.

"I have told a few of my followers to search for rented houses that have good public transport connectivity," he added.

"Once I finalise the house, I will give the address to my followers," said Swamiji.'

b'Hubballi: BS Yediyurappa might see my nomination for Lok Sabha polls as a misadventure. But for Dharwad voters, it is an adventure," said Dingaleshwar Swamiji of Bhavaikyata Peetha in Shirahatti. Speaking to reporters after holding a meeting with Muslim religious heads in Hubballi on Wednesday, Swamiji said, "I am contesting on the insistence of the voters of Dharwad.It is not my personal decision. Yediyurappa has spoken to me about stepping back from the fray, but I told him that my stand is unwavering." "Most of the leaders who accompanied Union minister Pralhad Joshi to Dharwad, while filing nomination, are those who have been oppressed by him and who have become politically destitute," he claimed. He also said the nomination papers, as an independent, will be submitted within the time specified by the Election Commission without seeing any muhurta on April 18.\n\nMeanwhile, Gunadharanandi Maharaj of Varur Tirthakshetra said: "The time and place when Fakir Dingaleshwar Swamiji entered politics is not right. This is the question of the existence of Shirahatti\'s Fakireshwar Mahasansthan." TNN'

b'Hubballi: Bowing to the words from senior seer of Bhavaikyata Peetha, I have withdrawn my candidature as an independent candidate from Dharwad parliamentary constituency but my 'Dharma Yuddha' will continue, said Dingaleshwar Swamiji of Bhavaikyata Peetha in Shirahatti.

Speaking to reporters here on Monday, Swamiji said: "I am neither scared of anyone nor have I yielded to any kind of pressure.Senior seer of Shirahatti Mutt asked me not to contest in the election, following which I have withdrawn my nominations," he added.

When asked about his next move, Swamiji said there will be no changes in his opinion and that he will also work on defeating Joshi, he said. Replying to a query on whether he will support Congress in the parliamentary election, he said he has not taken any kind of decision yet.

He also said that MLA Basangouda Patil (Yatnal) is brainless. "He has criticised not only me, but everyone. I have not taken money from anyone. Anyone claiming to have given me money to contest the LS election or to withdraw the filed nomination can come forward," he added.

Confidential meeting

A confidential meeting of Congress functionaries and Dingaleshwar Swamiji was held at the residence of former MLC Mohan Limbikai. Dharwad district minister Santosh Lad, senior leaders of Congress party GS Gaddadevarmath, DR Patil, GS Patil and many other Congress leaders were present in the meeting. What they have discussed in the meeting is not known. When asked to minister Santosh Lad, he said they all have come to seek blessings from Swamiji.

BJP

focusing only on

Muslim angle: Lad

Dharwad district minister Santosh Lad alleged that the BJP only concentrated on Muslim angle for votes. "In the Neha Hiremath murder case, the BJP national president and others visited her house just for publicity. They are not really concerned about the pain of her family," he said.

"Even though so many Hindu women have been killed and raped across the state and the country, the BJP has not protested. This not the right time to talk about Neha's murder. BJP has made Neha Hiremath's house its campaign site," he remarked.

In reply to a statement by BJP state president Vijayendra, who termed Lad and CM 'Nalayak', Lad said: "Without Yeddiyurappa's name, Vijayendra is a zero. Who is he to call us nalayak? What service he has rendered to the society? MLA Vijayendra should withdraw his statement and apologise."

"Dingaleshwar Swamiji has withdrawn his candidature as an independent candidate. Both CM and DyCM had asked him to withdraw. We approached him for blessings and appealed him to support the Congress candidate," said Lad.

17 remain in Dharwad fray

Seventeen candidates, including Union minister Pralhad Joshi of BJP and Vinod Asuti of Congress, have remained in the final fray for Dharwad Lok Sabha seat after the deadline for withdrawal of nominations ended on Monday. Twenty-five candidates had submitted their nominations. Eight of them, including Dingaleshwar Swami, withdrew their papers on Monday, paving the way for 17 candidates to fight it out.'

b'Dharwad: The announcement of Dingaleshwar Swami of Shirahatti-Balehosur Fakir Mutt that he would contest the Lok Sabha poll from Dharwad with the sole objective of defeating Union minister Pralhad Joshi has sparked off debate whether the pontiff's foray would have any impact on the results.

The seer's announcement has evoked sharp reactions from devotees of Fakir Mutt which is a 'Bhavaikyata mutt' (institution of communal harmony).At a meeting held at Shirahatti-Laxmeshwar, the devotees have taken serious exception to the seer's decision and firmly told him to refrain from contesting.

They claimed that Dingaleshwar was just a 'Uttaradhikari' of the senior pontiff of the mutt and should quit his position in the mutt if he wants to enter politics. They have set April 18 as the deadline for the pontiff to change his decision.

"Fakireshwar Mutt has devotees from all communities and different political affiliation. The mutt cannot support a particular candidate or a party. Dingaleshwar should keep up the tradition of the mutt. If he is keen on contesting, he should quit the Uttaradhikari peetha," said former MLA Ganganna Mahantshettar.

Dingaleshwar has insisted that he would fight the election and would not budge to pressure from anyone. Congress had toyed with the idea of supporting him by withdrawing its candidate Vinod Asooti who is a Kuruba but backtracked after chief minister Siddaramaiah showed the red flag.

'Lingayat card won't work'

Political analysts and those who know the history and political behaviour of the voters in the constituency are of the firm opinion that Dingaleshwar's plank of playing the Lingayat card does not work as the constituency has never gone by caste considerations.

Dharwad constituency has 43% of Lingayat electorates followed by 34% of OBCs including Kurubas, 17% Muslims, 3% Raddi community and 3% Brahmins.

Lingayats are the deciding factor in the constituency's history as there is proof that the voters have not considered the caste while electing their representative. Instead, they have voted for the party. Over a dozen Lingayat candidates were fielded from different political parties here but the caste card has failed to help the candidate win.

"Religious leaders trying to hog the limelight and nursing political ambitions is not new. Earlier Maathe Mahadevi of Kudalsangama had contested without success. It was Father Jacob who was once elected as MLA from Kalghatagi. Dingaleshwar will find the turf slippery in the absence of any development agenda to place before the electorate," said the head of a religious institution.'

b'BENGALURU: Karnataka govt has been accused of delayed action regarding the sex video case allegedly involving JD(S) MP Prajwal Revanna, leading to a heated debate between Congress and BJP, with questions raised about political motives.

Congress's decision to wait until after the first phase of voting in the state on April 26 is attributed to political calculations.Sources said the party aimed to avoid alienating Vokkaliga voters, dominant in phase 1, given the antipathy towards Kurubas, represented by CM Siddaramaiah. Former PM HD Deve Gowda's clan is regarded as the first family of Vokkaligas.

Siddaramaiah's govt formed an SIT after elections in south Karnataka in which three members of Gowda's family, including Prajwal, contested. Gowda's grandson Prajwal is seeking re-election from Hassam as an NDA candidate while his father HD Revanna is JD(S) MLA for Holenarsipur. Both were named in an FIR this Sunday in which a former domestic help accused father-son duo of sexually harassing her and her daughter.

Questions are being asked why govt's intervention came only after voting was completed, allowing Prajwal to leave the country, though the clips on pen drives were circulating widely before April 26.

BJP alleged friendly relations between Revanna and politicians influenced govt's actions. Union minister Pralhad Joshi said Prajwal was allowed to fly abroad after "an agreement between the CM and Revanna". "To cover up its lapse, state govt is blaming Union govt...None of us have opposed Prajwal's suspension from the party. Still, Congress is blaming NDA," he said.

Congress functionary Priyanka Gandhi, addressing a rally in Kalaburagi, questioned PM Narendra Modi's silence on the issue, given BJP and JD(S) are allies in these elections. In response, Union home minister Amit Shah shifted the responsibility onto state govt. "We want to ask why Congress, despite being in office in Karnataka, hasn't acted. Priyanka should ask Siddaramaiah and deputy CM DK Shivakumar," Shah said in Guwahati.

Shivakumar defended the delay, stating that action cannot be taken based on oral allegations without a bona-fide complaint from survivors.'

b'Hubballi: The Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee is gearing up for parliamentary elections in the second phase, not leaving any stone unturned and strengthening the party structure by involving MLAs and party workers from other districts.

The KPCC recently appointed minister Dinesh Gundu Rao as the in-charge of the Dharwad parliamentary constituency and has recruited observers to assist Gundu Rao in streamlining the campaigning and also to give a tough fight to Union minister Pralhad Joshi.

The KPCC has appointed observers for Hubballi-Dharwad West, Hubballi-Dharwad Central, Kundgol and Shiggaon. The constituency where the observers have been appointed do not have a strong party base, because of which they lost the constituencies in assembly elections held a year ago, said sources in the Congress party.

The BJP almost completely covered the Dharwad constituency twice, whereas the Congress is running short because of poor party organisation and infighting.

Sources in the party expressed concern over adjustment politics during meetings held in the presence of the district and state leaders.

Considering the opinions of the party workers in large with the hope of winning in the election, the party has appointed minister Dinesh Gundu Rao as an in-charge and also observers for various constituencies.

For the constituencies covered with many voters, Hubballi-Dharwad West and Hubballi-Dharwad Central MLA M Krishnappa and youth Congress leader Raksha Ramaiah have been appointed.

Former MLC M Narayanaswamy has been appointed as the observer for Kundgol constituency, and MLA AB Ramesh Bandesiddhegowda has been appointed for Shiggaon constituency.

Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao said that party workers have been working with zeal. "District minister Santosh Lad and others have worked hard, and the same will continue. In a couple of days, an intensified campaign drive will be launched.

The party has appointed observers for assembly constituencies to encourage and build confidence among the party workers. These observers will assist me and the campaigning will be carried out effectively," he added.'

b'Police try to control a scuffle between Congress and JD(S) workers over the alleged scandal involving Prajwal Revanna, in Hubballi, on Tuesday

BENGALURU: Even as a 21-member Special Investigation Team is ready to fan out across Karnataka to dig up truth in the sex video case allegedly involving Prajwal Revanna, the big question is: Why did the Congress govt act after polling in South Karnataka (in which three members of the Gowda family, including Prajwal, contested) was done and dusted.

Given that the sex tapes were widely in circulation much before April 26 (day of polling) and the govt was aware of it, that they took action post voting, which allowed Prajwal to flee India, has raised eyebrows.The Hassan MP was suspended from JD(S) early Tuesday.

Former PM Deve Gowda's grandson Prajwal is NDA candidate from Hassan, and his father HD Revanna is Holenarsipur MLA. Both have been named in an FIR in which a former housemaid accused the father-son duo of sexually harassing her and daughter.

This delayed action has led to a war of words between Congress and BJP, especially since BJP and JD(S) are allies for LS polls in which the junior partner is contesting from three seats. Priyanka Gandhi, in Kalaburagi on Monday, questioned PM Modi's silence on the issue. In response, Union home minister Amit Shah fastened the responsibility on the Congress-led state govt. "It is a very serious issue, and we cannot tolerate it. We want to ask why Congress, despite being in power in Karnataka, hasn't acted yet? Priyanka should ask CM Siddaramaiah and deputy CM DK Shivakumar," he said.

Congress waiting for the first phase of voting to be over is attributed to political arithmetic. Congress, according to sources, did not want to alienate the Vokkaliga voters, who were dominant in Phase 1, especially given their antipathy to Kurubas. As Siddaramaiah is a Kuruba, it would have looked like a Kuruba CM had gone after the first family of Vokkaligas.

S ources said the govt could not have booked a case without a bona-fide complaint from victims. Shah insulated the Centre from any likely negative fallout, saying a law-and-order issue falls in the state's domain and clarified the BJP "is in favour of investigations being conducted by SIT set up by the state govt". Akhila Vidyasagar, core committee member of Karnataka Mahila Dourjanya Virodhi Okkoota, which submitted a memorandum to ECI and the women's commission, said the govt should have been "swift" in action.

"The main question is why did the authorities remain mute spectators when the victims were airing their grievances in many fora... for more than a year now?" Deputy CM Shivakumar said they were aware of the clips for a long time, but the govt cannot unilaterally act and book a case in the absence of "a proper complaint from victims.

BJP functionaries are claiming that at the heart of the delayed govt action is Revanna's friendly equations with politicians of all hues, including Congress. Union minister Pralhad Joshi alleged Prajwal was allowed to fly out after "an agreement between the CM and Revanna". "To cover up its lapse, the state govt is blaming the Centre."'

b'Hubballi: Siya Vamansa Khode, a National Bravery Award winner, instituted by the Indian Council for Child Welfare, has expressed her ire against Union minister Pralhad Joshi.

She has released an audio clip saying she is a national bravery awardee in 2016. "I have got voting power for the first time. Though it's seven years after being honoured with the award, you (Joshi) neither helped us nor even spoke just for courtesy.When my parents brought me to you, you neglected us. Other MPs call and felicitate national awardees and show respect. Why should I vote for you," she questioned.

Siya's father Vamansa Khode confirmed that the audio is recorded by his daughter. "Now, she is pursuing BCom at a private college and she recorded her feelings on Saturday and released it on social media," he added.

She was honoured by the Prime Minister in Jan 2017 for rescuing her younger brother who had come in contact with a live wire on April 14, 2015. Knowing that she would be electrocuted, she had held his shirt and pulled him tightly. After detaching him from the wire, though she fell to a distance, she screamed out for help. Later her parents immediately took him to the hospital.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi had tweeted about her saying, "Siya Vamansa Khode from Karnataka is an inspiration for everyone. Her fearlessness saved her brother from electrocution" in his official tweet dated Jan 23, 2017.'

b'Dharwad: Union minister Pralhad Joshi, who is seeking a fifth term to Lok Sabha from Dharwad, said the Congress is hesitant to declare Rahul Gandhi as the PM candidate fearing that it could result in a loss of votes for the party in the election.

Addressing an election meeting at Sattur of Dharwad, he said the Nehru-Gandhi family ruled India for 58 years during which the country did not see much progress.

"The present 'fake' Gandhi clan has no prime ministerial candidate and hence has been ruling the party by proxy. There is a big difference between the previous Nehru-Gandhi family and the present Gandhi family," he said.

"For a country to be safe and robust there should be a strong defence and economic policy and the BJP-led NDA is thinking of such policies. But Congress is interested in appeasement politics to grab power. It is not bothered about India's security," Joshi charged.

Joshi claimed that the country had seen tremendous development in the construction of highways during BJP rule. During the Congress regime, 60,000km of highways were constructed, while Atal Bihari Vajapayee's regime saw the construction of 30,000km of highways in just five years. Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his 10-year tenure has ensured that 60,000km of highways including four lanes, six lanes, eight lanes and ten lanes are constructed, he asserted.

Referring to India's security forces, Joshi said at present the country can enter the terrorist hubs from the front and demolish them. "Earlier, there used to be serial bomb blasts and innocents were being killed by the terrorists. India's reaction was to light a candle to mourn the dead and keep quiet. Now it is different. Indian forces can smash the terror hubs by venturing into their terrain," he said.

Joshi appealed to the voters to elect him to complete the ongoing projects and get new projects for the region to ensure further development.'

b"Hubballi: The BJP Mahanagar and Rural ST Morcha will organise the 'ST Munnade' conference on Saturday at Gokul Garden, Hubballi.

Speaking to reporters here on Thursday, BJP functionary Arun Kumar Hudali said that former CM Basavaraj Bommai, Union minister Pralhad Joshi, former minister B Sriramulu, MLA Aravind Bellad, MLA Mahesh Tenginakai, MLA MR Patil, MLC Pradeep Shettar, and others will attend.ST Morcha state president Bangaru Hanumanta will lead the conference. About 10k workers are expected to participate, he said.

He said that the Union govt has released Rs 1,17,943 crore for the development of the ST community in 2023-24. 23.4 lakh people have been given land rights under the Forest Rights Act. The Valmiki Development Corporation was established when the BJP govt was in power in the state. The govt has declared a holiday on Valmiki Jayanti. The percentage of reservation for the ST community was increased from 3% to 7%, he added."

b'Haveri: Voters\' wishes of seeing Narendra Modi as the Prime Minister for the third time will be fulfilled, said BJP state president BY Vijayendra. He said BJP workers are showcasing the Union govt\'s achievements and convincing voters about the state govt\'s failures. "Modi\'s permanent guarantee will be successful over state govt\'s guarantees," he added.When asked about Fakir Dingaleshwar Mahaswamiji\'s revolt against Union minister Pralhad Joshi, he said he and Yediyurappa tried to talk to the seer. "The issue will be resolved by the time of election," he hoped. On speculations over the state govt\'s fall after the Lok Sabha election, he said he never felt that DK Shivakumar will be a mute spectator to see Siddaramaiah\'s administration. TNN'

b'Hubballi: Senior national Congress functionary and former CM Veerappa Moily urged the people of Dharwad to defeat Union minister Pralhad Joshi to get the long pending Hubballi-Ankola railway project.

Speaking in Congress office on Wednesday, he said he had a lot of hope that that after becoming a Union minister Joshi will help complete all long-pending projects related to Karnataka, but Joshi remained a minister for only Hubballi-Dharwad.

"Joshi being a member of parliament for 20 years and also the Union parliamentary affairs minister, he has done nothing for issues related to Karnataka which includes the Hubballi-Ankola railway project.
